action.name: SCAN
action.description: The SCAN action is the systematic examination of some aspect of the entity or its environment in order to obtain information.
action.specifier: This action can be used to command the characterization of an environment (e.g., perform network, port, or vulnerability scanning) or to look for a specific occurrence of an object (e.g., file, IP, process). SCAN commands are distinct from the QUERY in that SCAN implies an analytic while a QUERY implies a routine retrieval of data.
action.occurs: Actions that Gather and Convey Information

action.name: LOCATE
action.description: The LOCATE action is used to find an object either physically, logically, functionally, or by organization.  This action enables one to tell where in the system an event or trigger occurred.
action.specifier: This action is used for example to enable one to tell where in the system an event or trigger occurred, confirm that an asset is appropriately deployed, or ascertain details regarding a rogue device.
action.occurs: Actions that Gather and Convey Information

action.name: QUERY
action.description: The QUERY action initiates a single request for information.
action.specifier: QUERY, like SCAN, is used to find out more information about the system or its environment.  In the case of QUERY, however, it is an isolated or specific information request, rather than a broadly scoped scan or on-going check.  QUERY tends to be a simple retrieval of a value for a specific parameter, while SCAN implies a more thorough examination and identification of anomalies (relative to a known good state).   The response to a query is typically (but not necessarily) conveyed within the command and control channel.
action.occurs: Actions that Gather and Convey Information

action.name: REPORT
action.description: The REPORT action tasks an entity to provide information to a designated recipient of the information.
action.specifier: The REPORT action is used to request an actuator/sensor to provide certain information.  Along with the REPORT action and the type of information being requested, the recipient of the information must be specified in the command. The response to a REPORT action is typically (but not necessarily) conveyed outside of the command and control channel.
action.occurs: Actions that Gather and Convey Information

action.name: GET
action.description: The GET action tasks an entity to retrieve a specific object.
action.specifier: The location of the object can be designated in the specifier of the TARGET.  The entity typically (but not necessarily) retrieves the object outside of the command and control channel.
action.occurs: Actions that Gather and Convey Information

action.name: NOTIFY
action.description: The NOTIFY action is used to direct an entity to send information to another entity.
action.specifier: NOTIFY is distinct from REPORT in that NOTIFY is used for time sensitive event notification and carries a sense of persistence.
action.occurs: Actions that Gather and Convey Information

action.name: DENY
action.description: The DENY action is used to prevent a certain event or action from completion, such as preventing a flow from reaching a destination (e.g., block) or preventing access.
action.specifier: The DENY action can be used to prevent a flow from reaching a destination (e.g., block) or prevent access.  DENY is a superset of current terms such as BLOCK (network perimeter devices) and DENY (user, access to system, access to files).

action.name: CONTAIN
action.description: The CONTAIN action stipulates the isolation of a file or process or entity such that it cannot modify or access assets, processes or other  that support the business and/or operations of the enclave.
action.specifier: The CONTAIN action is a superset of currently used terms such as ISOLATE, QUARANTINE or SANDBOX.

action.name: ALLOW
action.description: The ALLOW action permits the access to or execution of something.
action.specifier: An ALLOW action is typically associated with something that was previously denied (e.g., block, quarantine).

action.name: START
action.description: The START action initiates a process, application, system or some other activity.

action.name: STOP
action.description: The STOP action halts a system or ends an activity.
action.specifier: The STOP OpenC2 action is used to convey commonly used actions such as shutdown, kill, and terminate. The STOP action has nuances and options associated with it that are ACTUATOR specific.  In the case where more than one type of STOP action is applicable for a particular target and actuator, the default implementation of STOP will be a graceful shutdown. Action modifiers are used to indicate immediate or atypical STOP actions.

action.name: RESTART
action.description: The RESTART action conducts a STOP of a system or an activity followed by a START of a system or an activity.
action.specifier: A RESTART implies a graceful shutdown, maintenance of state, and a new configuration.

action.name: PAUSE
action.description: The PAUSE action ceases a system or activity while maintaining state.
action.specifier: A PAUSE remains in effect until a RESUME is issued, unless the PAUSE action is accompanied by modifier for a time-interval.

action.name: RESUME
action.description: The RESUME action starts a system or activity from a paused state.
action.specifier: RESUME is only meaningful after a PAUSE command.

action.name: SET
action.description: The SET action changes a value, configuration, or state of a managed entity within an IT system.
action.specifier: Typically this action is specified by a configuration item such as a sensor setting or privilege level and the command will have specifiers.  SET commands are intended for specific individual changes to the entity and the parameters are communicated in the C2 channel.

action.name: UPDATE
action.description: The UPDATE action instructs the component to retrieve and process a large or comprehensive software update, reconfiguration, or some other update.
action.specifier: The settings, files, patches associated with an UPDATE action are typically retrieved out of band from the control channel.   UPDATE actions typically do not need to include details such as reboot or restart.  It is incumbent upon the OpenC2 compliant devices to include implementation details.  Modifiers such as ‘immediate’ and specifiers such as the path for the software may be added.

action.name: MOVE
action.description: The MOVE action changes the location of a file, subnet, network, or, process.
action.specifier: MOVE is distinct from CONTAIN in that CONTAIN implies a desired effect of isolation and MOVE supports the more general case.

action.name: REDIRECT
action.description: The REDIRECT action changes the flow of traffic to a particular destination other than its original intended destination.
action.specifier: The REDIRECT action includes the case of bypassing an intermediate point. REDIRECT is distinct from MOVE in that it encompasses the entire flow rather than a single instance, item or object.  MOVE supports the more atomic case.

action.name: DELETE
action.description: The DELETE action removes data and files.

action.name: SNAPSHOT
action.description: The SNAPSHOT action records and stores the state of a target at an instant in time.

action.name: DETONATE
action.description: The DETONATE action executes and observes the behavior of an object (e.g., file, hyperlink) in a manner that isolates the object from assets that support the business or operations of the enclave.
action.specifier: DETONATE is distinct from CONTAIN in that DETONATE includes an execution and analytic component rather than just isolation.

action.name: RESTORE
action.description: The RESTORE action deletes and/or replaces files, settings, or attributes such that the state of the system is identical to its state at some previous time.
action.specifier: The RESTORE could impact the whole system or return the state of an application or program to its previous state.  RESTORE can be used to undo a previous action.

action.name: SAVE
action.description: The SAVE action commits data or system state to memory.

action.name: MODIFY
action.description: The MODIFY action augments, enhances, transforms, or changes some aspect of a system.
action.specifier: MODIFY is used to change the attributes or behavior of some system element without stopping it or removing it from the system. MODIFY is a superset of commands such as set and rename.

action.name: THROTTLE
action.description: The THROTTLE action adjusts the throughput of entire data flow to a different  rate.

action.name: DELAY
action.description: The DELAY action stops or holds up an activity or data transmittal.
action.specifier: The period of time for the delay can be specified in a modifier to the DELAY action.

action.name: SUBSTITUTE
action.description: The SUBSTITUTE action replaces all or part of the data, content or payload in the least detectable manner.
action.specifier: SUBSTITUTE is used in cases where an attack is to be impeded or thwarted in an undetectable manner.

action.name: COPY
action.description: The COPY action duplicates a file or data flow.

action.name: SYNC
action.description: The SYNC action synchronizes a sensor or actuator with other system components.

action.name: DISTILL
action.description: The DISTILL action tasks the sensor to send a summary or abstraction of the sensing information instead of the raw data feed.
action.specifier: The DISTILL action reduces the amount of sensor data.  The means of reduction or filtering is indicated by a specifier.

action.name: AUGMENT
action.description: The AUGMENT action tasks the sensor to do a level of preprocessing or sense making prior to sending the sensor data.
action.specifier: The means of augmentation and the source of additional data are indicated by a specifier.

action.name: INVESTIGATE
action.description: The INVESTIGATE action tasks the recipient enclave to aggregate and report information as it pertains to an anomaly.
action.specifier: Examples of actions resulting from a received INVESTIGATE OpenC2 command could include scan multiple machines, quarantine an endpoint, or detonate a file. These actions are determined by the enclave based on the results of sense-making/analytics and decision-making based on operational constraints and mission needs.

action.name: MITIGATE
action.description:
The MITIGATE action tasks the recipient enclave to circumvent the problem without necessarily eliminating the vulnerability or attack point.  
Mitigate implies that the impacts to the enclave’s operations should be minimized while addressing the issue.
action.specifier: Examples of actions resulting from a received MITIGATE OpenC2 command could include deny a URL or process, scan, redirect traffic to honeypot, or move.

action.name: REMEDIATE
action.description:
The REMEDIATE action tasks the recipient enclave to eliminate the vulnerability or attack point.  
Remediate implies that addressing the issue is paramount.
action.specifier: Examples of actions resulting from a received REMEDIATE OpenC2 command could include contain/quarantine to a VLAN, set authorizations, redirect URL to quarantine portal, get new configuration, or update patches.

action.name: REMOVE
action.description: REPLACED WITH DELETE

target.name: cybox:Account
target.description: The Account object is intended to characterize generic accounts.

target.name: cybox:Address
target.description: The Address object is intended to specify a cyber address.
target.specifier:
cybox:AddressObjectType:
Address Value, VLAN Name, VLAN Num

target.name: cybox:AS
target.description: The AS element is intended to characterize a single autonomous system (AS).

target.name: cybox:Code
target.description: The Code object is intended to characterize a body of computer code.

target.name: cybox:Custom
target.description: The Custom object is intended to characterize objects that are not described by other defined CybOX Object schemas. Objects of this type have no pre-defined properties but instead all properties are provided by the author..

target.name: cybox:Device
target.description: The Device object is intended to characterize a specific Device.
target.specifier:
cybox:DeviceObjectType:
Description, Device Type, Manufacturer, Model, Serial Number, Firmware Version, System Details

target.name: cybox:Disk
target.description: The Disk object is intended to characterize a disk drive.
target.specifier:
cybox:DiskObjectType:
Disk Name, Disk Size, Free Space, Partition List, Type

target.name: cybox:Disk_Partition
target.description: The Disk_Partition object is intended to characterize a single partition of a disk drive.
target.specifier:
cybox:DiskPartitionObjectType:
Created, Device Name, Mount Point, Partition ID, Partition Length, Partition Offset, Space Left, Space Used, Total Space, Type

target.name: cybox:Domain_Name
target.description: The Domain_Name object is intended to characterize network domain names.
target.specifier:
cybox:DomainNameObjectType:
Value

target.name: cybox:Email_Message
target.description: The Email_Message object is intended to characterize an individual email message.
target.specifier:
cybox:EmailMessageObjectType:
Header, Email Server, Raw Body, Raw Header, Attachments, Links

target.name: cybox:File
target.description: The File object is intended to characterize a generic file.
target.specifier:
cybox:FileObjectType:
File Name, File Path, Device Path, Full Path, File Extension, Size In Bytes, Magic Number, File Format, Hashes, Digital Signatures, Modified Time, Accessed Time, Created Time, File Attributes List, Permissions, User Owner, Packer List, Peak Entropy, Sym Links, Byte Runs, Extracted Features, Encryption Algorithm, Decryption Key, Compression Method, Compression Version, Compression Comment

target.name: cybox:Hostname
target.description: The Hostname object is intended to specify a particular network hostname.
target.specifier:
cybox:HostNameObjectType:
Hostname Value, Naming System

target.name: cybox:Image_File
target.description: The Image_File object is intended to characterize image files.
target.specifier:
cybox:ImageFileObjectType:
Image File Format, Image Height, Image Width, Bits Per Pixel, Compression Algorithm

target.name: cybox:Memory
target.description: The Memory_Region object is intended to characterize generic memory objects.
target.specifier:
cybox:MemoryObjectType:
Hashes, Name, Memory Source, Region Size, Block Type, Region Start Address, Region End Address, Extracted Features

target.name: cybox:Mutex
target.description: The Mutex object is intended to characterize generic mutual exclusion (mutex) objects.

target.name: cybox:Network_Connection
target.description: The Network_Connection object is intended to represent a single network connection.
target.specifier:
cybox:NetworkConnectionObjectType:
Layer3 Protocol, Layer4 Protocol, Source Socket Address (IP Address/Port), Destination Socket Address, (IP Address/Port)

target.name: cybox:Network_Flow
target.description: The Network_Flow_Object object provides a summary of network traffic, expressed as flows of multiple packets instead of individual packets, without the packet payload data (i.e. the actual data that was uploaded/downloaded to and from the Dest IP to Source IP as included in packet monitoring tools, such as Wireshark).
target.specifier:
cybox:NetworkFlowObjectType:
Network Flow Label (Src Socket Address, Dest Socket Address, IP Protocol), Unidirectional Flow Record, Bidrectional Flow Record

target.name: cybox:Network_Packet
target.description: The Network_Packet object provides the definition of a network packet based on the TCP/IP model/Internet protocol suite. In the TCP/IP stack, "packet" is generally defined as IP header plus payload, but we also include the LinkLayer from the OSI model, which defines the physical network interfaces and routing protocols. The application layer has not yet been defined.
target.specifier:
cybox:NetworkPacket:
Link Layer, Internet Layer, Transport Layer

target.name: cybox:Network_Subnet
target.description: The Network_Subnet object is intended to characterize a generic system network subnet.
target.specifier:
cybox:NetworkSubnetObjectType:
Name, Description, Number Of IP Addresses, Routes

target.name: cybox:Port
target.description: The Port object is intended to characterize networking ports.
target.specifier:
cybox:PortObjectType:
Port Value, Layer4 Protocol

target.name: cybox:Process
target.description: The Process object is intended to characterize system processes.
target.specifier:
cybox:ProcessObjectType:
PID, Name, Creation Time, Parent PID, Child PID List, Image Info, Argument List, Environment Variable List, Kernel Time, Post List, Network Connection List, Start Time, Status, Username, User Time, Extracted Features

target.name: cybox:Product
target.description: The Product object is intended to characterize software or hardware products.
target.specifier:
cybox:ProductObjectType:
Edition, Language, Product, Update, Vendor, Version, Device Details

target.name: cybox:System
target.description: The System object is intended to characterize computer systems (as a combination of both software and hardware).
target.specifier:
cybox:SystemObjectType:
Available Physical Memory, BIOS Info, Date, Hostname, Local Time, Network Interface List, OS, Processor, Processor Architecture, System Time, Timezone DST, Timezone Standard, Total Physical Memory, Uptime, Username

target.name: cybox:URI
target.description: The URI object is intended to characterize Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI’s).
target.specifier:
cybox:URIObjectType
Value

target.name: cybox:User_Account
target.description: The User_Account object is intended to characterize generic user accounts.
target.specifier:
cybox:UserAccountObjectType:
Full Name, Group List, Home Directory, Last Login, Privilege List, Script Path, Username, User Password Age

target.name: cybox:User_Session
target.description: The User_Session object is intended to characterize user sessions.
target.specifier:
cybox:UserSessionObjectType:
Effective Group, Effective Group ID, Effective User, Effective User ID, Login Time, Logout Time

target.name: cybox:Volume
target.description: The Volume object is intended to characterize generic drive volumes.
target.specifier:
cybox:VolumeObjectType:
Name, Device Path, File System Type, Total Allocation Units, Sectors Per Allocation Unit, Bytes Per Sector, Actual Available Allocation Units, Creation Time, File System Flag List, Serial Number

target.name: cybox:Windows_Registry_Key
target.description: Windows_Registry_Key object characterizes windows registry objects, including Keys and Key/Value pairs. See also: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms724871(v=vs.85).aspx.
target.specifier:
cybox:WindowsRegistryKeyObjectType:
Key, Hive, Number Values, Values, Modified Time, Creator Username, Handle List, Number Subkeys, Subkeys, Byte Runs

target.name: cybox:Windows_Service
target.description: Windows_Service object is intended to characterize Windows services. See also: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms685141(v=vs.85).aspx.
target.specifier:
cybox:WindowsServiceObjectType:
Description List, Display Name, Group Name, Service Name, Service DLL, Service DLL Certificate Issuer, Service DLL Certificate Subject, Service DLL Hashes, Service DLL Signature Description, Startup Command Line, Startup Type, Service Status, Service Type, Started As

target.name: cybox:X509_Certificate
target.description: X509_Certificate object represents a public key certificate for use in a public key infrastructure.
target.specifier:
cybox:X509CertificateObjectType:
Certificate, Raw Certificate, Certificate Signature
